title: "<" in pug doesn't work
body:
### env

macOS 10.12.1 Beta
nodejs 6.8.1
vuejs 2.0.3
### Steps to reproduce

init a test vue project with default options

``` bash
vue init webpack test
cd test
```

edit src/components/Hello.vue

```
<template lang="pug">
div
  div(v-if!="0 < 0")
</template>

<script>
export default {
}
</script>
```

then run dev server

``` bash
npm run dev
```
### What is actually happening?

got error:

```

> test@1.0.0 dev /Users/xiaoxiao/test
> node build/dev-server.js

< 0")
</template>

<script>

}
</script>

    at parseHTML (/Users/xiaoxiao/test/node_modules/vue-template-compiler/build.js:3434:13)

Child html-webpack-plugin for "index.html":
         Asset     Size  Chunks       Chunk Names
    index.html  1.46 MB       0
webpack: bundle is now VALID.
```
### description

Similar issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/3731 . However, situations are not the same. Replace "<" with ">" won't trigger this error. It's not a bug of pug as the error occurs before pug was called. In fact, this error happens even if pug is not installed.

Thanks for your time to review this issue.
